result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquille J. Brown Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shaquille J. Brown Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J. Brown Johnson in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case parties state appearances.  Parties have rec/rev PSI.  State states recommendations filed in writing to the Court today and victims were notified and no statements to be provided.  Atty Masana makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE reads statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court follows joint recommendations.

Probation for 6 years
Conditions of probation:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan 
DNA sample to be provided

Comply w/case plan goals
Any other recommendations per DOC
Do/complete any assessssments as recommended per agent
Obtain GED or HSED
Obtain/maintain full-time employment
No contact w/females under 18 per agent excluding his daughter
If probation is revoked, there is no sentence credit available (Court explains credit is being applied to other sentences)
Must comply w/sex offender registration
May be released from requirement to continue reporting if probation is successfully completed

Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states all matters are resolved and a PSI is to be requested.  State is in agreement and states recommendations.  State will not object to DE applying for 973.048(1m)(b) re: sex offender registration.  Atty Masana is in agreement, as is the DE.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Court accepts pleas and finds DE guilty.  Parties agree to one hour for sentencing hearing.  Court orders PSI be completed in 16CF80 no later than 10/28/2016 with sentencing set for 11/22/2016.  Bonds continued pending sentencing.
